panels.visual: Days later. Giovanni finds Bansi in Hind's supply tent, her hands buried in a chest of coins. Her expression shifts to innocent confusion, but the priest's eyes are hard.
panels.dialogue: Giovanni: "You were stealing. From the woman who pays our wages."

panels.visual: Bansi withdraws her hands, empty, and meets Giovanni's eyes directly. Her posture is defensive but honest. The mask has dropped.
panels.dialogue: Bansi: "Old habits. I've been on my own a long time. When you're alone, you take what you can."

panels.visual: Giovanni sits down on a crate, his posture relaxing. To Bansi's surprise, he isn't angry - he's understanding. A ghost of a smile crosses his weathered face.
panels.dialogue: Giovanni: "I didn't always wear these robes. Before I was a priest, I was a merchant. Before that, a farm boy who watched his father get cheated."

panels.visual: Bansi laughs - a genuine sound, surprised out of her. Giovanni stands to leave, his warning delivered with unexpected kindness.
panels.dialogue: Giovanni: "I won't tell Hind. This time. But we're going to need to trust each other. You might want to start practicing."
